intro: Oreophysa microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved rock fern, is a member of the Polypodiaceae family. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or shaded environments. The plant features small, delicate leaves that are often clustered closely together. Its rhizome is short and thick, anchoring it to the substrate. Oreophysa microphylla is characterized by its ability to thrive in moist, nutrient-poor soils.
